text: Cloverbrook was an American Thoroughbred racehorse that won the 1877 Preakness Stakes and Belmont Stakes, races that would become the second and third legs of the U.S. Triple Crown series. Cloverbrook was the first horse to win the Preakness Stakes that had been bred and trained in Maryland. He was bred and raced by Edwin Augustus Clabaugh of Carroll County, Maryland and trained by Jeter Walden, a brother to Hall of Fame trainer R. Wyndham Walden. ==Pedigree== ==References== Category:1874 racehorse births Category:Racehorses bred in Maryland Category:Racehorses trained in the United States Category:Preakness Stakes winners Category:Belmont Stakes winners Category:Byerley Turk sire line Category:Thoroughbred family 15-d
title: Cloverbrook
